meanings.definition: To free from embarrassment or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She disembarrassed herself from the awkward situation by making a joke.
meanings.sent2: He disembarrassed his friend by helping her find the right words to say.
meanings.sent3: The cat disembarrassed itself from the sticky tape by rolling around on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays disembarrassed the garden of the morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick disembarrassed the audience from their skepticism.

meanings.definition: To rid of obstacles or hindrances.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew disembarrassed the road of debris after the storm.
meanings.sent2: She disembarrassed her mind of doubts before the important exam.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel disembarrassed the bird feeder of all the seeds in no time.
meanings.sent4: The broom disembarrassed the floor of dust and dirt.
meanings.sent5: The wind disembarrassed the tree of its colorful leaves in the fall.
